snippet: Mitt Romney has arrived at a strange and unfamiliar moment. The political prize that eluded him four years ago, and his father, George, decades before that, is suddenly within agonizingly close reach.
abstract: Mitt Romney has arrived at a strange and unfamiliar moment; the political prize that eluded him in 2008, and his father George four decades before that, is suddenly within agonizingly close reach; aides close to Romney say he is exuding a new and unmistakable confidence despite a seemingly endless primary filled with attacks by Democrats on the private equity firm he founded, a botched foreign trip and, not infrequently, his own political gaffes.

byline.original: By ASHLEY PARKER and MICHAEL BARBARO

lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney has arrived at a strange and unfamiliar moment. The political prize that eluded him four years ago, and his father, George, decades before that, is suddenly within agonizingly close reach.

headline.seo: Romney, a Challenger at the Crossroads
headline.main: Romney, a Challenger at the Crossroads
